meanings.sent1: She kept missetting the clock, so it was always showing the wrong time.
meanings.sent2: He tends to missetting the table, putting the forks where the spoons should be.

meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a missetting compass, always pointing in the wrong direction.

meanings.definition: An act of setting or placing something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The missetting of the alarm caused her to oversleep.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the missetting of the sign, which led people in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent3: The missetting of the stage props made the play even more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The missetting of expectations left everyone surprised by the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The missetting of the thermostat made the room unbearably hot.
